Updated November     pm





Junior Cole Bradley putts the ball during the Boilermaker Invitational on April  PERIOD

For the first time since the  Purdue will be represented on Memorial Day at the NCAA Championships as Cole Bradley punched his ticket to the final round PERIOD

Bradley shot a 5over par  to finish the 54hole qualifier in 4over par   and place tied for twenty-eighth to move on to Mondays final round PERIOD Bradley finished tied for fourth among the nine individuals qualifying that werent on one of the  advancing teams PERIOD A total of  players will compete for individual

medalist honors on the Grayhawk Golf Clubs Raptor Course PERIOD

Bradley started his round on the back nine and after a pair of bogeys in the opening four holes he responded with birdies on Nos PERIOD  and  to move to evenpar on his round PERIOD A bogey on  dropped him to 1over par making the turn PERIOD

He then suffered his first doublebogey on the par4 second hole and followed with bogeys on Nos PERIOD   and  PERIOD He would record a big birdie on the par4 ninth hole to end his round at 5over par  PERIOD

Bradley then was forced to wait for the afternoon wave to finish up to learn his fate on advancing to Monday PERIOD

Bradley will tee off Mondays final round at  a.m PERIOD PT   p.m PERIOD ET PERIOD He is the first Boilermaker since Shiv Kapur finished tied for tenth at the  NCAA Championships to play in the final round PERIOD

Mondays final round will air live on the Golf Channel beginning at  p.m PERIOD ET PERIOD
